qas.question: When did the incidence of TB in Europe reach its highest point?
When tuberculosis was at its worst in Europe, what percentage of deaths was TB-related?
What British health organization made tuberculosis its top priority at its start?
What year was the Medical Research Council created?
About how much had the death rate from TB been reduced in Europe by the midpoint of the 20th century?
What percentage of deaths were caused by TB in the 1950s?

plausible_answers.text: the arrival of streptomycin and other antibiotics

qas.question: What reduced rates of mortality in the 1950s?
What organization brought antibiotics to Britain?

context: In Europe, rates of tuberculosis began to rise in the early 1600s to a peak level in the <a0_0>1800s<a0_0/>, when it caused nearly <a1_0><b5_0>25%<b5_0/><a1_0/> of all deaths. By the 1950s, mortality had decreased nearly <a4_0>90%<a4_0/>. Improvements in public health began significantly reducing rates of tuberculosis even before <b6_0>the arrival of streptomycin and other antibiotics<b6_0/>, although the disease remained a significant threat to public health such that when the <a2_0><b7_0>Medical Research Council<b7_0/><a2_0/> was formed in Britain in <a3_0><b8_0>1913<b8_0/><a3_0/>, its initial focus was tuberculosis research.
